description: Investigators on Sunday searched a home connected to the 20-year-old would-be assassin who fired at former President Donald Trump while he was speaking at a rally Saturday. The shooter, from Bethel Park, Pennsylvania, was killed by Secret Service agents. Charlie De Mar reports.
title: Details emerge as investigation into Trump shooter continues

description: President Biden urged Americans not to draw conclusions about former President Donald Trump's would-be assassin until the FBI can complete a thorough investigation. Mr. Biden is set to address the nation Sunday night from the Oval Office. Nancy Cordes reports.
title: President Biden responds to attempted Trump assassination

description: Those working closely with former President Donald Trump on his reelection bid are hoping to cool things off following Saturday's failed assassination attempt. Several key Trump allies, including his wife Melania, have issued statements and Trump's own camp sent out a memo saying it would not tolerate dangerous rhetoric. Robert Costa has more.
title: Trump camp looks to ease tensions after failed assassination attempt

description: Former President Donald Trump was shot​ in an assassination attempt at the campaign rally and said a bullet pierced the upper part of his right ear.
title: Trump shot at rally in failed assassination attempt. Here's what we know.

description: Officials with the Secret Service, the FBI and the City of Milwaukee briefed reporters Sunday on security plans for the Republican National Convention set to begin Monday in Wisconsin. Meanwhile, FBI officials released new details about their investigation into the assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump at his campaign rally in Pennsylvania Saturday. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane and Nicole Sganga report.
title: Secret Service says it's confident in RNC security plans after Trump rally shooting

description: Spain has won a record fourth European Championship title after Mikel Oyarzabal's 87th-minute goal clinched a 2-1 victory as England's painful decades-long wait for a major trophy goes on.
title: Spain wins 4th European Championship title, beating England 2-1

description: King Charles and Queen Camila's trip to Australia and Samoa will mark their first visit abroad since the king's cancer diagnosis in February.
title: King Charles make first international royal trip since cancer diagnosis

description: FBI investigators have released new details about Thomas Matthew Crooks, the 20-year-old Bethel Park, Pennsylvania, resident who shot at former President Donald Trump at a campaign rally Saturday. A local official apparently encountered the shooter moments before he fired eight rounds into the ground, CBS News Pittsburgh reports. CBS News' Nicole Sganga reports.
title: Municipal officer encountered Trump rally shooter before assassination attempt

description: Both patients who were hospitalized are now in stable condition, per state police.
title: Pennsylvania State Police identify 3 victims shot at Trump rally

description: Former President Donald Trump is recovering at his New Jersey residence following the assassination attempt made against him Saturday, but he says he still plans to travel to Milwaukee, Wisconsin, for this week's Republican National Convention. CBS News national correspondent Errol Barnett is in New Jersey with more.
title: Trump recovering in New Jersey after assassination attempt

description: Details are coming out about the shooter who tried to assassinate former President Donald Trump at a rally on Saturday. CBS News crime and public safety senior coordinating producer Anna Schecter has the latest on what we know about the investigation.
title: What we know about investigation into Trump shooting

description: Former President Donald Trump says he will still attend this week's Republican National Convention after the assassination attempt made against him at a rally Saturday. CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns has more on the RNC.
title: Trump says he'll still attend RNC, convention making changes after assassination attempt

description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Sen. Tom Cotton and Rep. Jason Crow join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation," July 14, 2024

description: Sources tell CBS News that the gun used in Saturday's assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump was legally purchased and that the ATF and FBI have traced it to the shooter's father. CBS News Homeland Security and Justice reporter Nicole Sganga has more.
title: Gun in assassination attempt belonged to Trump shooter's father, sources say

description: President Biden said during a White House address on Sunday that there would be an independent, public review of the security at Saturday's Trump rally where an assassination attempt was made on the former president. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more on that and changes to the Biden campaign in the wake of the shooting.
title: Biden says there will be independent review of security at Trump rally where shooting happened

description: An ex-classmate of the gunman who fired shots at former President Donald Trump described 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks as a "normal boy."
title: Ex-classmate of Trump rally shooter describes him as "normal boy"

description: Americans have been living in a heightened threat environment for some time, and Saturday's assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump confirmed Americans' greatest fears, Margaret Brennan says.
title: Assassination attempt against Trump confirmed Americans' greatest fears

description: CBS News cybersecurity Expert Chris Krebs tells "Face the Nation" that in the aftermath of the shooting at a Trump rally that grazed the former president's ear, social media platforms need to "act responsibility and step in as appropriate" to prevent misinformation from spreading.
title: Cybersecurity expert urges social media sites to "act responsibly and step in as appropriate"

description: A.T. Smith, former Secret Service deputy director and CBS News national security contributor, tells "Face the Nation" that sources told him the agency had an "adequate amount of time" to prepare for former President Donald Trump's rally, while former Homeland Security official and CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd notes the importance of being "as transparent as possible" as conspiracy theories have begun to pop up online.
title: Ex-Secret Service official says sources said agency had "adequate amount of time" to prepare

description: We're learning more about the shooter in Saturday's assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump. CBS News correspondent Charlie De Mar has more on that.
title: New details on Trump shooter, mixed reactions amongst people who knew him

description: President Biden on Sunday again condemned the assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump, noting he had spoken with Trump on the phone and that the White House did not have any information yet on the motive of the shooter. Maurice DuBois anchored CBS News' special report on the president's address.
title: Watch: Biden delivers remarks on Trump assassination attempt | Special Report

description: In the wake of Saturday's assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump, questions are being asked about how the shooter was able to get so close. Former FBI supervisory special agent Eric Miller joined CBS News to speak about that.
title: Questions about how shooter got so close to Trump

description: Authorities searched the Pennsylvania home of the would-be Trump assassin's home Sunday after finding explosive material in his vehicle. CBS News correspondent Charlie De Mar has more on that.
title: Trump rally shooter's home searched by investigators

description: Parts of Minnesota are still assessing damage after storms late Saturday and overnight left some with large hail​​, and others with high winds that knocked down trees and led to power outages for tens of thousands.
title: More chances for severe storms in Minnesota loom going into Monday

description: Democratic Rep. Jason Crow of Colorado tells "Face the Nation" that he is still concerned that President Biden is on a losing path, and "unless there's a major change," he believes "there is a high risk" that Democrats lose the election.
title: Rep. Jason Crow says without "major change," there's a "high risk" that Democrats lose in 2024

description: President Biden spoke with former President Trump by phone Saturday after the attempt on Trump's life hours earlier at a rally. Biden has condemned the shooting. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: Details on Biden security briefing, phone call with Trump after assassination attempt

description: Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas, a close ally of former President Donald Trump, tells "Face the Nation" that "it's a difficult day for Americans" after an assassination attempt against the former president.
title: Sen Tom Cotton says "it's a difficult day for Americans" after Trump shooting

description: The Trump campaign increased security at their offices in Washington, D.C., and West Palm Beach following Saturday's shooting at a Pennsylvania rally where former President Donald Trump's ear was grazed by a bullet and a bystander was killed. The assassination attempt comes days before the Republican National Convention is set to kick off in Milwaukee. CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns has more on the security measures at the convention.
title: How Trump rally shooting will impact Republican National Convention in Milwaukee

description: The Republican National Convention is set to start Monday, roughly 48 hours after former President Donald Trump was grazed by a bullet at a Pennsylvania rally in an assassination attempt. Ed O'Keefe reports from Milwaukee and Robert Costa has the latest from the Trump team.
title: RNC making final plans for convention after Trump rally shooting

description: Former President Donald Trump survived an assassination attempt Saturday when a gunman opened fire at Pennsylvania rally. A bullet grazed Trump's ear and a bystander was shot and killed. Del Quentin Wilber, an investigations editor at the Associated Press, joined CBS News to discuss previous assassination attempts on presidents and presidential candidates, and the impact of Saturday's shooting.
title: History of assassination attempts on presidents, presidential candidates

description: Law enforcement officials told CBS News homeland security reporter Nicole Sganga that there was a tip to the Butler County sheriff's office regarding a suspicious individual at the rally, but officials lost sight of him. Former President Donald Trump was grazed by a bullet and a bystander was killed.
title: Trump rally attendees reported gunman as a suspicious person before shooting

description: In addition to former President Donald Trump, at least one person was killed and two others critically injured when a gunman opened fire at the former president's rally in Pennsylvania. Scott MacFarlane, who was at the rally, spoke to an eyewitness who administered CPR on the victim.
title: Eyewitness who administered CPR to Trump rally shooting victim: "There was lots of blood"

description: Rep. Jason Crow, a Colorado Democrat, says that in the wake of Biden's debate performance, there's a "high risk" that Democrats lose the election "unless there is a major change."
title: Rep. Crow says without "major change," there's "high risk" Democrats lose election

description: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro provided an update on the investigation into Saturday's assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump. Shapiro said the shooting at the rally was "absolutely unacceptable and tragic." Maurice DuBois anchored a CBS News Special Report.
title: Pennsylvania governor discusses investigation into Trump assassination attempt | Special Report

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Rep. Jason Crow, Democrat of Colorado, on "Face the Nation" that aired on July 14, 2024.
title: Transcript: Rep. Jason Crow on "Face the Nation," July 14, 2024

description: Governor Shapiro provided the update on Sunday afternoon along with Pennsylvania State Police.
title: Pennsylvania man killed at Trump rally identified: "Corey died a hero."

description: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris received an updated briefing in the Situation Room on Sunday.
title: Watch Live: Biden to speak from White House after assassination attempt on Trump

description: Hamas rejected the idea that mediated cease-fire discussions had been suspended after the strike.
title: Hamas says Gaza cease-fire talks haven't paused

description: Pennsylvania Rep. Dan Meuser was sitting in the front row watching former President Donald Trump's speech at a campaign rally in Butler when shots rang out, telling CBS News 24/7 that there were "a lot of tears."
title: Rep. Dan Meuser was in front row of Trump rally when shots rang out

description: President Biden denounced political violence after the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump during Saturday's rally in Pennsylvania. The White House said Mr. Biden and Trump had a "good, short and respectful" call following the shooting where the former president's ear was grazed by a bullet. A bystander was also killed. Senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: Biden receiving security briefing on Trump rally shooting

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sen. Tom Cotton, Republican of Arkansas, on "Face the Nation" that aired on July 14, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. Tom Cotton on "Face the Nation," July 14, 2024

description: Reince Priebus, President Donald Trump's former chief of staff and chair of the Milwaukee 2024 Host Committee for the upcoming Republican National Convention, said there's a lot of emotion and reflection going around. He tells CBS News' John Dickerson we should "be thankful for a miracle" that Trump is safe after Saturday's tragic events.
title: Reince Priebus says "be thankful for a miracle" Trump's safe after assassination attempt

description: The physician, who wore a T-shirt soaked in blood, said the victim had a gunshot wound to the head and had fallen between the bleachers.
title: Doctor at Trump rally says he tried to save wounded shooting victim

description: The Spaniard won his first Slam title at the 2022 U.S. Open as a teenager, and no man ever has collected more Slam hardware before turning 22 than he has.
title: Carlos Alcaraz tops Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon for 4th Slam title

description: A gunman opened fire while former President Donald Trump was speaking at a Pennsylvania rally on Saturday. Trump said in a social media post that a bullet pierced his ear. The FBI identified the suspect as 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks and the motive remains unclear. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has more from Butler.
title: How the Trump rally shooting unfolded

description: Officials found explosive materials in the vehicle of the suspect who opened fire at Saturday's rally while former President Donald Trump was speaking on stage, a law enforcement source told CBS News. Homeland security and justice reporter Nicole Sganga has more on what we've learned so far about the 20-year-old suspected shooter.
title: Suspect in Trump rally shooting had explosive materials in vehicle, source says

description: House Majority Leader Steve Scalise said Saturday's shooting at a Trump campaign rally in Pennsylvania "brought back a lot of memories," referring to when he was nearly killed in June 2017 when a gunman ambushed the Republican congressional baseball team. Watch his full interview with CBS News 24/7.
title: Steve Scalise says Trump rally shooting "brought back a lot of memories"

description: The gunman who opened fire Saturday night at Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, was armed with an AR-15, about 400 feet from the stage.
title: Maps show location of Trump and gunman at Pennsylvania rally shooting

description: Donald Trump will officially become the 2024 GOP nominee at this week's Republican National Convention in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
title: The 2024 Republican National Convention begins tomorrow. Here's what to know.

description: The Trump campaign is still planning to move forward with their 2024 Republican National Convention plans, including selecting former President Donald Trump's VP pick, despite security concerns following Saturday's rally shooting.
title: 2024 RNC and Trump VP selection plans to move forward, sources say

description: A shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally on Saturday sent shock waves across the U.S. as lawmakers denounced political violence. Watch a CBS News special report on the investigation into the shooting as authorities learn more information about the gunman. Plus, we talk to eyewitnesses who share their firsthand accounts of the incident.
title: Shooting at Trump rally sends shock waves across U.S. | Special Report

description: The Trump rally shooting is raising concerns about political violence in the U.S. Anthony Salvanto, CBS News' executive director of elections and surveys, joins CBS News 24/7 to break down past polling.
title: Trump rally shooting draws attention to concerns about political violence

description: With the Republican National Convention set to kick off in Milwaukee​ on Monday as scheduled, Wisconsin officials are decrying the attempted assassination of presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump​.
title: Ahead of Milwaukee RNC, Wisconsin officials decry "horrific act" after Trump assassination attempt

description: Presidential historian Douglas Brinkley, a professor of history at Rice University, says the rare images from Saturday's Trump rally shooting will "live eternally," and his mind immediately jumped to the 2024 Republican National Convention in Milwaukee. Watch the full interview on CBS News 24/7.
title: Photos showing blood on Trump's face will "live eternally," presidential historian says

description: Former President Donald Trump was grazed by a bullet during a Pennsylvania rally on Saturday.
title: Melania Trump releases statement after husband's assassination attempt

description: Law enforcement officials are swarming the neighborhood of the Trump rally gunman after Saturday's shooting, speaking to neighbors and conducting an investigation of the premises. KDKA investigative reporter and anchor Meghan Schiller reports.
title: Neighbor speaks out amid investigation at Trump rally gunman's home

description: Dr. Jim Sweetland, an ER physician who helped administer aid to a Trump rally shooting victim, described the dramatic scene to CBS News 24/7. He also recalled sharing an emotional moment with an Army veteran afterward. (Warning: This video contains graphic details and violent content. Viewer discretion is advised.)
title: ER doctor who helped Trump rally shooting victim recalls emotional moment with Army vet

description: Jacoby Jones, former wide receiver and kick return specialist for the Baltimore Ravens, has died.
title: Jacoby Jones, former Baltimore Ravens wide receiver, dies at 40

description: "CBS Mornings" co-anchor Tony Dokoupil reports from the 2024 Republican National Convention arena in Milwaukee. Dokoupil says "a whole different reality set in" after supporters watched the shooting unfold at a Trump rally in Pennsylvania.
title: Trump supporters in Milwaukee react to rally shooting: "Everything has changed"

description: Questions remain about the Trump rally shooter and how he was able to get a clear line of sight of the former president at his Pennsylvania campaign event. A.T. Smith, the former Secret Service deputy director and CBS News consultant, tells CBS News 24/7 about what investigators know so far.
title: Questions about how Trump rally gunman was able to get into position

description: Witness Erin Autenrieth recalls former President Donald Trump's reaction after a bullet grazed his ear at a Pennsylvania campaign rally. He was shielded by Secret Service members after gunshots rang out.
title: Witness recalls Trump's reaction after rally shooting

description: CBS News 24/7 brings you witness accounts and the latest information early Sunday as we learn more about Saturday's shooting at a Trump rally in Pennsylvania. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott Macfarlane, who was at the rally, gives an update on the facts we know so far.
title: Breaking down Trump rally shooting investigation findings

description: Shannen Doherty had been battling cancer since 2015.
title: Shannen Doherty, "Beverly Hills, 90210" and "Charmed" star, dies at 53

description: The Trump campaign sent a memo on Sunday morning urging staff members to avoid offices and be on alert following a shooting at a Pennsylvania rally. CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.
title: Trump campaign sends new memo to staff after rally shooting

description: New details emerged overnight about the investigation into the shooting at former President Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. A bystander was killed, two others were critically wounded and Trump said a bullet grazed his ear. The gunman was killed by a Secret Service sniper at the rally, officials said. CBS News 24/7 brings you the latest in this special coverage on Sunday morning.
title: What we know so far about investigation of Trump rally shooting | Special Coverage

description: Reactions are pouring in from across the world as leaders condemn political violence, express condolences and share well wishes for former President Donald Trump following Saturday's shooting at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania. CBS News correspondent Ian Lee reports from London.
title: World leaders condemn Trump rally shooting, political violence

description: Political leaders denounced violence and shared words for the American public and former President Donald Trump following Saturday's shooting at a Pennsylvania campaign rally.
title: Political leaders react to Trump assassination attempt

description: Butler County District Attorney Richard Goldinger joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss the latest on the investigation into Saturday's Trump rally shooting.
title: Butler County DA: Questions still need to be answered in Trump rally shooting probe

description: A.T. Smith, the former Secret Service deputy director and CBS News consultant, gives insights into the response to Saturday's Trump rally shooting. "You do have to remember these things happen in a split second or in a very few seconds," Smith said.
title: Ex-Secret Service deputy director on Trump rally shooting: "These things happen in a split second"

description: CBS News campaign reporter Jake Rosen reports from Pennsylvania after speaking with multiple witnesses of Saturday's shooting at a Trump rally.
title: Witnesses describe Trump rally shooting, recall helping victims

description: CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett joins CBS News 24/7 from Milwaukee ahead of the 2024 Republican National Convention to discuss what to expect after Saturday's shooting at a Trump rally.
title: What to expect at 2024 RNC following Trump rally shooting

description: Nationally, about half of Democrats continue to say Biden should step aside as nominee in the wake of his poor debate performance against Trump in June.
title: Poll: Trump maintains edge over Biden in battlegrounds on eve of GOP convention

description: Fitness guru Richard Simmons, who helped millions lose weight by preaching the value of exercise and movement, died Saturday, July 13, 2024, at age 76. In this November 30, 2003 commentary recorded for "Sunday Morning," Simmons offered his advice on dealing with holiday feasts, diets, and the benefits of "moving and grooving."
title: From the archives: Richard Simmons' advice on exercise

description: Investigators are searching the home of the Trump rally gunman who the FBI identified as 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks of Bethel Park, Pennsylvania. Anna Schecter Zigler, senior coordinating producer for CBS News and Stations' Crime and Public Safety Unit, joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss the ongoing investigation.
title: Investigators search Trump rally gunman's Pennsylvania home

description: This month's recommended fiction and non-fiction titles include new novels by Joseph O'Neill, Claire Lombardo and Julia Phillips, and a biography of abolitionist Harriet Tubman.
title: The Book Report: Washington Post critic Ron Charles (July 14)

description: Melissa Shaffert, who witnessed the shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania on Saturday, describes the moments she first heard gunshots and what it was like learning more details about the incident after she got home.
title: Trump rally shooting witness on rewatching news on TV: "Unbelievable to see"

description: The "Sunday Morning" book reviewer offers his picks from this month's new titles, including novels by Joseph O'Neill, Claire Lombardo and Julia Phillips, and a biography of abolitionist Harriet Tubman.
title: 7/14: The Book Report by Washington Post critic Ron Charles

description: The White House confirmed that President Biden and former President Donald Trump spoke by phone late Saturday night after a shooting at his rally in Pennsylvania. In public remarks, Mr. Biden said, "There's no place in America for this kind of violence." CBS News' Skyler Henry has more.
title: Biden and Trump spoke by phone after the rally shooting

description: The FBI identified the gunman who fired shots during former President Donald Trump's campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, as 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks. The FBI and federal law enforcement are searching the premises of the gunman's home in Pittsburgh, officials said.
title: FBI identifies Trump rally gunman, searches his home

description: Former President Donald Trump said he looks "forward to speaking to our Great Nation this week from Wisconsin."
title: Trump says "we stand United" after assassination attempt

description: The author of "Netherland" and "The Dog" returns with a novel about a bizarre scheme to find the next international soccer star.
title: Book excerpt:  "Godwin" by Joseph O'Neill

description: The bestselling author of "Disappearing Earth" returns with a hypnotic, tense story about sisters whose lives are upended by the presence of a bear near their home.
title: Book excerpt: "Bear" by Julia Phillips

description: The latest novel by the bestselling author of "The Most Fun We Ever Had" follows the upheavals in the life of a complicated woman unprepared for a mid-life crisis.
title: Book excerpt: "Same As It Ever Was" by Claire Lombardo

description: National Book Award-winning author Tiya Miles explores the history and mythology of a remarkable woman.
title: Book excerpt: "Night Flyer," the life of abolitionist Harriet Tubman

description: Since late May, North Korea has floated numerous balloons carrying waste paper, scraps of cloth, cigarette butts and even manure toward South Korea.
title: Kim Jong Un's sister hints at resuming flying trash balloons to South Korea

description: Former President Trump was injured in a shooting at a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. The FBI has identified the gunman as 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks.
title: Trump rally gunman identified as Pennsylvania man

description: Pat Milton, senior producer of the CBS News Investigative Unit, reports the latest details on the investigation into the attempted assassination of former President Trump.
title: What we know so far about investigation into attempted assassination of Trump

description: Presidential historian Douglas Brinkley, a professor of history at Rice University, joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss past assassination attempts in U.S. history and the lasting impact of Saturday's shooting at former President Trump's rally in Pennsylvania.
title: Presidential historian on past assassination attempts in U.S. history

description: A Biden campaign official says the campaign is pausing all outbound communications and working to take down their television ads as quickly as possible following the shooting at a Trump rally in Pennsylvania. CBS News' Skyler Henry has more.
title: Biden campaign pausing communications, taking down TV ads after Trump rally shooting

description: A witness of Saturday's Trump rally shooting said he felt distressed after watching the scene unfold. CBS News campaign reporter Jake Rosen reports.
title: Witness says he's distressed after watching Trump rally shooting unfold

description: House Majority Leader Steve Scalise said he texted back and forth with former President Donald Trump after shots were fired at his campaign rally in Pennsylvania, saying Trump was doing fine. He shares more details with CBS News 24/7.
title: Steve Scalise shares texts from Trump after rally shooting

description: Authorities held a news conference late Saturday to give an update on the shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, which is being investigated as an attempted assassination. One audience member is dead and at least two were critically injured in the shooting. The gunman is also dead. Trump said a bullet pierced the upper part of his right ear. Watch the full news conference.
title: Officials share new details on Trump rally shooting, investigation of assassination attempt

description: Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss Saturday's Trump rally shooting. "We're supposed to be a more perfect union," said McCarthy, urging Americans to respect each other's opinions. "That's what democracy is about."
title: Former Speaker Kevin McCarthy shares message after Trump injured in assassination attempt

description: Members of law enforcement and federal agents are at the scene of former President Donald Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, where a shooting took place earlier Saturday. CBS News' Scott Macfarlane and Ed O'Keefe report.
title: Authorities at scene investigating Trump rally shooting

description: Pennsylvania Rep. Mike Kelly tells CBS News 24/7 he saw people scattering as security surrounded former President Donald Trump after shots rang out at Saturday's campaign rally in Pennsylvania.
title: Rep. Mike Kelly says "through an act of God" Trump is safe after shooting

description: Former President Donald Trump was released from the hospital late Saturday after he said he was shot with a bullet that pierced the upper part of his right ear during a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.
title: Trump released from hospital after apparent assassination attempt at rally

description: CBS News campaign reporter Olivia Rinaldi shared a video of members of the press and attendees taking cover as shots rang out at former President Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania. She described the terrifying scene to CBS News' Margaret Brennan on CBS News 24/7.
title: CBS News reporter shares video of people taking cover during Trump rally shooting

description: Bryan Patrick Miller says he didn't viciously murder two young women in Phoenix over 30 years ago. At trial, his attorneys blamed being abused as a child for his violent behavior.
title: Zombie Hunter's unique murder defense: His mother created a monster

description: A.T. Smith, the former Secret Service deputy director and CBS News consultant, joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss the response to Saturday's shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania.
title: Former Secret Service deputy director discusses Trump rally shooting

description: "CBS Mornings" co-host Tony Dokoupil reports from the ground in Milwaukee ahead of the 2024 Republican National Convention, saying the tone and tenor have changed after people heard about the shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania on Saturday. An eyewitness at the Trump rally said the shooting was "so scary" and recalled seeing blood splatter across Trump's face.
title: "So scary": Eyewitness recalls seeing blood splatter on Trump's face

description: U.S. lawmakers, including President Biden, expressed outrage and shock over Saturday's shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania. Here's the latest.
title: Lawmakers express shock and outrage over Trump rally shooting

description: An attendee at the Trump rally told CBS Pittsburgh he saw the alleged shooter on a rooftop about "200 to 250 yards" away
title: Trump rally attendee says he saw alleged shooter "move from roof to roof"

description: The 1990 murder of Marlene Warren, shot by someone dressed as a clown, haunted the public and investigators as the case went unsolved for more than 30 years.
title: After three decades, Florida "killer clown" case ends with unexpected twist

description: CBS News' Major Garrett is in Milwaukee ahead of the 2024 Republican National Convention. He says he's seen more police presence following Saturday's shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.
title: What we know about RNC security plans after shooting at Trump's Pennsylvania rally

description: Direct assaults against presidents, presidents-elect, and candidates have occurred on 15 separate occasions in the U.S., with five resulting in death, according to a 2008 report​ compiled by the Congressional Research Service.
title: A look at past attacks against U.S. presidents and candidates

description: Former President Donald Trump posted a statement on Truth Social on Saturday night after shots were fired at his Pennsylvania rally. In the post, he thanked law enforcement for their quick response and said he was "shot with a bullet that pierced the upper part of my right ear."
title: Trump says bullet "pierced the upper part of my right ear" in shooting at rally

description: Eyewitness Melissa Shaffert recalled hearing what sounded like fireworks at former President Donald Trump's rally Saturday before she said chaos ensued. Shaffert tells CBS News' Margaret Brennan about what she saw.
title: Witness at Trump rally says she could "actually hear bullets whizzing by"

description: "I knew immediately that something was wrong in that I heard a whizzing sound, shots, and immediately felt the bullet ripping through the skin," former President Trump wrote.
title: Trump says bullet "pierced the upper part of my right ear" at rally

description: Witness Josh Drespling said he was at Saturday's Trump rally in Pennsylvania when he heard pops of gunfire. He tells CBS News' Margaret Brennan what he saw.
title: Eyewitness shares video from Trump rally after shots fired

description: Eyewitnesses at a rally of former President Donald Trump's described a chaotic scene on Saturday after he was rushed off stage with blood visible on his face after shots were fired.
title: Trump rally attendees react to shooting: "I thought it was firecrackers"

description: Dr. Jim Sweetland is an ER physician who was on the scene at former President Donald Trump's rally Saturday in Pennsylvania when shots rang out. He told CBS News about administering CPR to an audience member who had been hit. (Warning: This video contains disturbing language and violent content.)
title: Doctor details treating audience member shot at Trump rally

description: President Biden spoke Saturday about the shooting at a Trump rally hours earlier. Biden said the former president was safe and called the incident sick before saying "everybody must condemn it." Watch the president's full remarks.
title: Biden addresses shooting at Trump rally: "Everybody must condemn it"

description: David McCormick, a GOP Senate candidate for Pennsylvania, was at the Trump rally Saturday when shots rang out and says he was near an audience member who had been hit. McCormick described the scene to CBS News.
title: Senate candidate describes chaos at Trump rally after shots fired: "It was just mayhem"

description: Multiple law enforcement sources tell CBS News contributor Richard Esposito that a shooter who fired at Donald Trump during a rally Saturday was neutralized. Adriana Diaz anchored CBS News' special report.
title: Assailant at Trump rally "neutralized by Secret Service," law enforcement sources say

description: A man who says he's an emergency room physician told CBS News on Saturday that he ran over to help a victim after shots were fired at former President Donald Trump's campaign rally in Pennsylvania. CBS affiliate KDKA reports the shooter and an audience member have both been killed. (Warning: This video contains disturbing language and violent content that some may find disturbing.)
title: Man at Trump rally says he rushed to help victim after shots fired

description: Congressman Mike Kelly of Pennsylvania was at Donald Trump's rally Saturday when the Secret Service rushed the former president off stage. He described the scene to CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa.
title: Pennsylvania Rep. Mike Kelly describes scene at Trump rally after "shots rang out"

description: President Biden issued a statement on Saturday following a shooting at former President Donald Trump's rally, saying he's "grateful to hear that he's safe and doing well. I'm praying for him and his family and for all those who were at the rally, as we await further information." CBS News' Ed O'Keefe has more.
title: Biden releases statement on shooting at Trump rally

description: The person believed to have fired shots during former President Donald Trump's rally is dead, two sources confirmed to CBS News.
title: Biden speaks after Trump rushed off stage when shots fired at rally: "It is sick"
